results.title: Advanced editing
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on advanced editing principles and the editing suite including the Beatcam editing suite, the S-VHS edit bench, how to assemble and insert edits, the mixing of sound including voice overs, graphics, sound effects and sound mixing.

results.title: Adults as learners. No. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Cash, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
Demonstrates in a machine shop situation how blind workers are taught. A practising artist explains to a group of varying ages and educational background the fundamentals of abstract art.

results.title: Adults as learners. No. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Anthony Cash, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teaching Adults”.
Examples of formal teaching and teaching by discovery with two groups of British Railways workers learning elementary electricity. A lesson on chess for a beginner, by the discovery method, is used to support the discussion.

results.title: Adult development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Rachel Rosenthal and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
For all of us, adult life is full of transitions and turning points. How do adults develop psychologically? Do their changes follow some set course, or is their growth varied and unpredictable? This program examines the major transitions in adult life - leaving home, parenting, mid-life crisis and retirement, by interviewing both psychologists and adults going through each of these stages.

results.title: Adolescent development = Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Adolescence is the period which occurs anywhere between 10 and 20 years of age, and during which we are trying to work out who we are. At this time we mature physically, sexually, socially, intellectually and morally, but not necessarily at the same rate, which is where some of the conflicts and embarrassments of adolescence occur. The peer group becomes of prime importance as it provides feedback on appropriate behaviour. This program takes a generally positive view of this period as an exciting challenge.

results.title: Adolescence: the prolonged transition
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Through historical and cross-cultural comparisons, the extent to which the concept of adolescence as a period of increased autonomy, identity development, and risk-taking, is a social construction, is examined. The biological aspects of puberty and emerging sexuality are addressed. Observes examples of adolescents in transition from family to a broader adult world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, DLGHS and GPN

group_works.title: Joe and Roxy
group_works.creator_credit: Don Haldane, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Adolescence: a case study
results.brief_description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.
results.description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.
